p: Thyroid gland dysfunction is a common medical condition [ 1â€“ 3]. Nowadays, many patients choose to use medicinal herbs and herb-based medications as an alternative or complementary treatment for various diseases and conditions including thyroid dysfunctions. Various medicinal herbs affect thyroid gland function. Gotu Kola ( Centella asiatica, L.), Ashwagandha ( Withania somnifera (L.) Dunal), and Guggul ( Commiphora mukul (Arn.) Bhandari) are effective for the treatment of hypothyroidism [ 4]. There are also medicinal herbs that have thyroid suppressive properties and can be recommended for the treatment of hyperthyroidism: bugleweed ( Lycopus virginicus, L.), gypsywort ( Lycopus europaeus, L.), Lemonbalsam ( Melissa officinalis, L.), Rosemary ( Rosmarinus officinalis, L.) and Sage ( Salvia officinalis, L.), and others [ 4].
